title: What’s your 80s punk rock band name? - Quora

response.answer_text: I was in post punk / swamp bands in the 90s called The Headstones (still like that name) The Scandinavian Lampshades (we had a gig, we didn’t have a name, we needed to print up a poster, we went passed a shop, it seemed like a good idea at the time) The Wild Irravel. (see above)

It was tha late 70s and I was in a Prog Rock band and we used to occasionally play in the guise of our punkish alter egos…. The name was “Dripping Peter”. The album we were jokingly supporting was ‘Feel The Burn’. We also had a version that was kind of a stoner-punk band…. “High Llama”. Had a cool logo too. In support of ‘Alpaca U Ass!’ Some of us grew up in the same neighborhood as the Tubes. And
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Luka Stefan Asceric
